item.title: Streamlining ASP.NET Core Cache Configuration
item.author: Author
item.description: Caching in web is super important for performance, and ASP.NET Core supports it out of the box - however configuring it the documented way can result in a lot of mess. Today we look how to make it cleaner without sacrificing any features.

item.title: My Recommended Mods for X4: Foundations
item.author: Author
item.description: In 2022 Steam Winter Sale X4 Foundations is seemingly getting some traction, and I keep seeing newcomers trying the game out and looking for tips. This post will not have tips perhaps, but I will recommend some solid mods for the game!

item.title: TehGM's C# Utilities v0.2.0
item.author: Author
item.description: Service lifetime-agnostic SemaphoreSlims, string randomization, JSON.NET support for UniqueIDs and more! Check out what was added to TehGM.Utilities library in version 0.2.0.

item.title: TehGM's C# Utilities v0.1.0
item.author: Author
item.description: Initial version of TehGM's C# Utilities released - but what is that?

item.title: TehGM's Stalker Anomaly Modpack V2
item.author: Author
item.description: Some time ago I posted my modpack for Stalker Anomaly. Recently I got back to it, and made some changes. New guns and now it also looks stunning - come, download and install!

item.title: TehGM's Docker Cheatsheet
item.author: Author
item.description:
Docker is awesome. However, more often than not I keep googling or copying from thing I previously used.

For this reason, I decided to build up a small personal cheatsheet of Docker commands/snippets. It’s primarily for my own purposes, but hey, why not share it publicly!

item.title: Inside SnipLink v0.2.0 - News Page
item.author: Author
item.description: SnipLink v0.2.0 released with News page feature. Let's see how it looks under the hood!

item.title: TehGM's Stalker Anomaly Modpack
item.author: Author
item.description: I compiled a quick modpack with the mods I use for Stalker Anomaly so you can download and experience it the way I do!

item.title: Compiling SASS and minifying JS and CSS with ASP.NET Core
item.author: Author
item.description: When working on my Link Shortener (coming soon!) project, I decided that using normal CSS is tedious, so I wanted to use SASS. But I didn’t want to compile it manually, so I ventured onto finding the solution that is ideal for me, and is easy to add at once - much easier than other tutorials I found online.
